attributes.action: Add British Sign Language to the British education curriculum
attributes.additional_details: A group of friends and I working with NCS recently went to Walthew House in Stockport; a charity for the blind and deaf. We met a blind man called Paul who was very insightful and told us about the difficulties the blind and deaf community face and the importance of communication.
attributes.background: We want British Sign Language to be taught in primary schools so more people can communicate with the deaf to prevent them from feeling excluded and be more included in society.
